The Real Leadership Lessons of Steve Jobs

Six months after Job's death, the author of his best-selling biography identifies the practices that every CEO. can try to emulate by Walter lsaacson

His sags is the entrepreneurial creation myth writ large Steve Jobs cofounder Apple in his parents garage in 1976, was ousted in 1985, returned to rescue it from near bankruptcy in 1997, and by the time he died, in octobar 2011, had built it into the world's most valuable company. Along the way he helped to transform seven industries Personal computing, animated movies, music, phones tablet computing, retail stores, and digital publishing. He thus belongs in the belongs in the pantheon of American's great innovators, along with thomas Edison, Henry Ford, and wait Disney None of these men was a saint, but long after their personalities are forgotten, history will remember how they applied imagination to technology and business.
